documentType: USCIS Form I-914 Supplement B (Declaration of Law Enforcement Officer for Victim of Trafficking)
summary: This is a USCIS Form I-914 Supplement B, a law enforcement certification for a victim of trafficking. It is completed by the FBI and certifies that the applicant is a victim of sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The document details the victim's recruitment, harboring, and abuse, her cooperation with the investigation, and her expressed fear of retaliation.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Identified as the individual who recruited, harbored, obtained, coerced, threatened, and forced the applicant into sexual slavery and subjected her to sex acts.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Identified alongside Jeffrey Epstein as a suspect/defendant in the criminal investigation; the applicant expressed fear of retaliation from individuals connected to her.

connections.description: Both are named as suspects/defendants in the same criminal investigation for trafficking, and threats are attributed to individuals connected to both.
Epstein is described as having recruited, harbored, obtained, coerced, threatened, and forced the applicant into sexual slavery and sex acts.
Maxwell is implicated in the alleged criminal acts for which the applicant participated in the investigation, and the applicant fears retaliation from individuals connected to Maxwell.

events.title: Trafficking and Abuse of Applicant
events.description: The applicant was recruited, harbored, and obtained by Jeffrey Epstein and others for sexual slavery. Epstein coerced, threatened, and forced her into submission for sex acts on numerous occasions, resulting in injuries.

events.title: Investigation/Prosecution Completion Date
events.description: The date provided as when the investigation or prosecution was completed.

events.title: Applicant's Cooperation with Investigation
events.description: The applicant participated in several telephonic and in-person meetings with the FBI office, responding to questions about alleged criminal activities by Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Threats and Fear of Retaliation
events.description: The applicant and her family received threats during her participation in the investigation/prosecution of Epstein and Maxwell. She expressed fear of serious harm from individuals connected to them if removed from the U.S.

locations: 26 Federal Plaza, New York, NY (FBI office mailing address)
keyFacts: A law enforcement officer from the Federal Bureau of Investigations certifies that the applicant is a victim of a severe form of sex trafficking by Jeffrey Epstein and others.
The applicant was recruited, harbored, and obtained for sexual slavery, and was coerced, threatened, and forced by Epstein into sex acts on numerous occasions, sustaining injuries.
The applicant participated in the investigation and prosecution of criminal charges against Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell, cooperating with law enforcement.

The applicant and her family received threats during her involvement in the case, and she fears serious retaliation from individuals connected to Epstein and Maxwell if removed from the United States.

The cited statutes for the acts of trafficking include 18 USC 371 (Conspiracy), 18 USC 1591 (Sex Trafficking), 18 USC 1623 (False Declarations), 18 USC 2423(a) (Transportation of Minors), and NYPL 130.55 (NY Penal Law).
